DataElement.preferredName: Patient Molecular Characterization Initiative for Childhood Cancers Testing Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether or not the patient consented to testing through the molecular characterization initiative for childhood cancers.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Molecular Characterization Initiative for Childhood Cancers Testing Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A part of the National Cancer Institute’s (NCI) Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI) that is a national collaboration within the childhood cancer community to provide state-of-the-art molecular characterization at the time of diagnosis in order to help participants and doctors select the best and most appropriate treatment._A procedure for critical evaluation._Permission to do something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Molecular Characterization Initiative for Childhood Cancers Testing Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: A part of the National Cancer Institute’s (NCI) Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI) that is a national collaboration within the childhood cancer community to provide state-of-the-art molecular characterization at the time of diagnosis in order to help participants and doctors select the best and most appropriate treatment._A procedure for critical evaluation._Permission to do something.

Concepts.longName: Molecular Characterization Initiative for Childhood Cancers
Concepts.definition: A part of the National Cancer Institute's (NCI) Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI) that is a national collaboration within the childhood cancer community to provide state-of-the-art molecular characterization at the time of diagnosis in order to help participants and doctors select the best and most appropriate treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.
